alert.note: Alert for Berks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 7:40PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Pennsylvania...including the following county...Berks. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 737 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated earlier heavy rain due to thunderstorms resulting in 1 to 2.5 inches of rain falling. Minor flooding may still be ongoing across portions of the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Reading, Wyomissing, Sinking Spring, Wernersville, Spring Ridge, Shillington, West Reading, Mount Penn, Mohnton, Kenhorst, St. Lawrence, and West Wyomissing. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 8 and 11. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
